summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking production of documentary evidence related to a victim (VE) of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse. The letter requests photos, videos, correspondence, and other documents to assist the victim's civil litigation and participation in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC who is co-signing the formal Touhy request letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking evidence for victim VE's case.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as a prolific pedophile who sexually assaulted the victim VE on two occasions in 2000 when she was 15 years old.

connections.description: Edwards is representing VE in her civil case and compensation claim against Epstein's associates.

events.title: Sexual assault of VE by Jeffrey Epstein

events.title: Formal Touhy request submitted
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC submits formal written request for documentary evidence related to victim VE to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a formal Touhy request from attorneys representing a victim (VE) of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse, seeking evidence from the Department of Justice.
VE was sexually assaulted by Epstein on two occasions in 2000 when she was only 15 years old.
The request seeks specific documentary evidence including photographs, videos, correspondence, and documents containing VE's true name.
The evidence is needed for VE's civil litigation and for her participation in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.
The letter references the civil case VE v. Darren K. Indyke, et al., SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07625.
